Articles.Content: westamastaflash made a recompile for 1.02 and it works alright, hasn't caused any problems.

I put my code on github so you can download the changes. I had made a change to add a text box to specify the hyper warp speed as well.

I think Xaiier was working on a rewrite a while ago.

https://github.com/ntwest/TimeControl/releases/tag/1.0.2

MIT License (included in download), created originally by Xaiier.

I did a recompile for 1.0.2 after correcting the max altitude exception when you go to the flight screen and it seems to be doing ok.

As this is MIT licensed, you can download my compile from here.

Hmm, seems to screw up the altitude display with my plane.
How well will this work with powered atmospheric flight? I'm looking for something to help cut down those slow low tech 3 hour flights to the survey point.

Hmm, seems to screw up the altitude display with my plane.

This is a known bug in the older versions, not sure if it can be fixed... but Kerbal Engineer will show the right altitude.

- - - Updated - - -

How well will this work with powered atmospheric flight? I'm looking for something to help cut down those slow low tech 3 hour flights to the survey point.

I've had very good luck with it, combined with a flight autopilot that keeps your plane steady.
Wait so this more or less works without problems?
Yes. Just use westamastaflash's build found in message 221.

His patch still seems to cause a small but annoying freeze for me every time I come out of timewarp. It might have to do with RPM.

EDIT: Aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaand it seems like it still has the space-center-gets-destroyed-when-you-leave-Kerbin's-SOI bug. Pity.

Edited June 9, 2015 by mythbusters844
I'm curious as to if anyone planning on updating this to 1.0.3? I'm presuming it doesn't work anymore
It works in 1.0.2, so why do you assume not in 1.0.3?

It works in 1.0.2, so why do you assume not in 1.0.3?

It doesn't work completely. It still has a massive lagspike when stopping timewarp. Also, if you travel to another SOI and return to the space center, it and the rest of Kerbin completely disappear and it requires a game restart in order to fix.

Edited July 12, 2015 by mythbusters844

I don't have any of those issues (in 1.0.2.) Works just as always. Have not tested in 1.0.3 yet.

Edited June 24, 2015 by bgeery

For RSS on 1.0.2, while around Moon, log gets spammed with this:

[LOG 03:47:30.406] Body change Earth to Moon
[EXC 03:47:30.407] NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object
        TimeControl.TimeControl.SetLocalCollision (System.String planetName, Boolean enabled)
        TimeControl.TimeControl.UpdateCollision ()
        TimeControl.TimeControl.flightUpdate ()
        TimeControl.TimeControl.Update ()

What is it, and how to fix it? Tell me if You need full logs.
This desperately needs an update! Please, dev, if you can't/won't do it, find someone who will!
Best fireworks ever.

It doesn't work completely. It still has a massive lagspike when stopping timewarp. Also, if you travel to another SOI and return to the space center, it and the rest of Kerbin completely disappear and it requires a game restart in order to fix.

I might look into this as it seems the OP has disappeared...

I'll see if I can figure out what's going on here also... I loved this mod.

Updated to 1.0.4.

Black screen in space center after switching SOI is fixed!

RSS / Kopernicus bugs should be fixed.

Also added time control icon to Stock Toolbar. It's a bit weird it makes you click it twice I'll try to get it sorted soon.

You can turn it off in config.txt. I put a placeholder in to turn off blizzy toolbar but didn't get to that yet.

Note that there will be a small freeze after coming out of timewarp, this is because of the bug fix for the exploding ships when using very high timewarp speeds.

GitHub Link (MIT License):

https://github.com/ntwest/TimeControl/releases/tag/1.0.4-hf-2

Ssometimes the space center controls lock up still. I haven't been able to reliably reproduce it but I think it has to do with being in a different SOI when you return to the space center.

westamastaflash are you basically maintaining Time Control for the foreseeable future? I'm curious because this mod is the best out there for improving frame rate (And thus create good cinematics).

westamastaflash are you basically maintaining Time Control for the foreseeable future? I'm curious because this mod is the best out there for improving frame rate (And thus create good cinematics).

I've sent a PM to the Xaiier to see if he's OK with me taking it over. If I don't hear back in a few weeks, and I have the time to spare I might put together a new thread with a few more bugfixes (day job is very busy and we've got a baby on the way).

But I will try to at least keep it functional for the new KSP updates.

Finally found a workaround for a troublesome bug.

If you find your space center locked out after changing SOIs, you need to either:

(1) Always switch to a vessel orbiting Kerbin and then time accelerate with it. This will reset the PQSCity objects of the space center and the colliders.

(2) Use the KSC Building Shortcuts modelet to go to the tracking station and switch to a vessel orbiting kerbin (or launch one from the mysteriously ghostly launch pad and get to space), then Time Accelerate to reset the objects.

I'm trying to figure out how to reset them when the space center scene is loaded. Once I have it fixed I will upload a fixed DLL.

This is going to sound like a stupid question but how do you even install this mod? I usually use CKAN for all my mods so I don't know how to properly install a mod downloaded directly from Curse, and I can't @#$%^&^ing find how to do it ANYWERE.
